t: A psalm. A song. For the dedication of the temple. Of David.
I*pn will exalt you, Lord,*s for*ld you lifted me out of the depths and*ld did not let my enemies gloat over me.
Lord*sln my God, I called to you for help, and*ld you healed me.
You,*ln Lord,*s brought me up from the realm of the dead; you*ld spared me from going down to the pit.
Sing*pn the praises of the Lord,*s you his faithful people; praise*ld his holy name.
For*ln his anger lasts only a moment, but*ld his favor lasts a lifetime; weeping*ln may stay for the night, but*ld rejoicing comes in the morning.
When*pn I felt secure, I said, “I*ld will never be shaken.”
Lord,*sln when you favored me, you*ld made my royal mountain stand firm; but*ln when you hid your face, I*ld was dismayed.
To*pn you, Lord,*s I called; to*ld the Lord I cried for mercy:
“What*ln is gained if I am silenced, if*ld I go down to the pit? Will*ln the dust praise you? Will*ld it proclaim your faithfulness?
Hear,*ln Lord,*s and be merciful to me; Lord,*sld be my help.”
You*pn turned my wailing into dancing; you*ld removed my sackcloth and clothed me with joy,
that*ln my heart may sing your praises and not be silent. Lord*sld my God, I will praise you forever.
